111111111212111111221112121121121.content:
"Kiba, Drago, where've you been?" You ask as they move into the room.
Drago plunked down on the couch, and Kiba sat on his bed.
"Drago and I were just taking care of business." Kiba says, cracking the cartilage in his fingers.
"What he said." Drago says as he stretches.
You look at the two, confused. Finally you shake your head, and walk over to your bag on your bed to get some clothes.
Turning around, you fall backwards onto the bed.
"So..." You say, staring up at the ceiling. "What kinds of people are here?"
Kiba looks over at you. "Kinds?"
You stare back. "Yeah, like, there wouldn't happen to be Goop Monsters or Water Sprites would there?"
At this, Kiba stares at Drago, who shrugs.
"Loads of 'em." Drago says.
You look back at the ceiling, thinking about the giggling in the shower. Finally you just shake your head and sit up.
"Anybody besides me hungry?" You say.
Drago smiles a toothy grin and stands.
"I could use a snack." He says.
111111111212111111221112121121121.title: Kiba and Drago

111112.content:
You turn and see a blue dragon. He towered three feet over you, and he seemed very chubby, making him at least three times your weight. He had a childish smile plastered on his face. "Hello, you must be Donald, my new roommate." He said, extending one claw. "I'm Veernes, but just call me Vee."
You smile and shake his claw. "It's nice to meet you Vee." You said.
"Do you want any help with your bags?" He asked .
You smile, and politely decline. He gestures you to follow him, and starts walking to the building. An anthro passes by. "Good luck, with Vee, you'll need it." He says rudely and keeps walking. You just stare wondering what he meant.
Vee leads you to his room, and you get situated. You could smell a foul oder in the room, making you wrinkle your nose. Vee just grins sheepishly. "Sorry if it kind of stinks in here, I kind of have bad gas, I don't know why, I think I was just born that way. That's why when ever I get a room mate, they leave." He sighs, looking disappointed in himself.
You smile warmly. "It's okay, I won't leave." You reassure him. You were too nice to actually leave him by his lonesome, and you could always appreciate a good fart joke, it made you seem childish but you didn't care.
Vee looks up and smiles. "Thanks... So what should we do now?"
111112.title: A blue dragon.

choices: "Fine, what do you want to know?"
111131.content:
It's the last week of summer vacation, and there's not much to do, so you just chill out at a nearby park, and watch the stars come out.
Staring up, you notice a bat hanging from the park light over your head, with it's wings huddled against itself. You look away, and see the other park lights start to light up along the pathway. You narrow your eyes, and see a man taking his dog for a walk.
As he passes, the dog, a Great Dane, licks your hand, and wags his tail as he goes by.
"Oh, come on..." you say to yourself, wiping your hand on your jeans.
You lean back on the bench, staring up a the stars again. You close your eyes, and imagine going to school next week. So much had happened this summer, where had the time gone? Your 5th girlfriend (who dumped you), the friend who moved away to go to college, moving from one house to another, all of it.
The world just couldn't leave you alone, could it?
No, it couldn't.
A noise next to you makes you open your eyes. You turn to see a man sitting next to you, munching a sandwich. He just sat there, chewing for a while, before finally saying, "It's a good night out."
You grunt.
The man takes another bite of his sandwich, and chews slowly, making you fight the urge to slap the thing out of his hand.
He looks at you, and you tense up. You'd heard of addicts and molesters haunting the park at night, but didn't think they were real.
Until now.
But yet, this man's eyes are clear blue, staring icily back at you.
You shiver.
"There's nothing to be worried about," the man said. "i just wanted to ask you something, Mark, about your future education."
You freeze. "How do you know my name?" you finally choke out.
"Oh, I know a lot about you." the man said, speaking slowly. "I know quite a lot, actually. But nevermind about that. What I want to know is how your doing, not me."
111131.title: Mark

choices: Wake up in a different world.
1111311.content:
You stand up. "That's none of your business dude." You say.
The man fixes you with another stare, still munching on that sandwich.
He chewed slowly, like he was pondering with every bite.
Finally he says: "What if I told you that your everyday life, your girlfriends, your pals, even your parents, were all unimportant...?"
You stare back at those eyes of his. "What do you mean?" You finally say.
The man sits back, throwing the rest of the sandwich in the bin next to the bench.
"I mean," he says with a grunt. "Your life up until now, is now... obselete. Everything about it, simply put, never happened."
You step back from the large man, your legs itching as you get ready to run.
"Right," You say. "As if I'm gonna believe that. Next thing you'll tell me is that fricken dwarves exist, and that fairies live in every corner of my house."
At this, the man smiles, and stands up. You take another step back, as the man was easily over 7 feet tall, with a full black beard and a heavy looking jacket. Reaching out a massive hand, he plunks it down onto your shoulder, pinning you under it's weight.
"You're closer than you think," he says.
With that, his other hand began waving in the air, making it shimmer vaguely.
"Now..." he says as he sets his second hand on your head. "Sleep."
1111311.title: "Get away from me."

Looking at the bat, it's clearly around Mark's size and half-human, wearing a pear of blue shorts and a T-shirt saying Mythical College. Looking over Belfry "Your quite different then any bat I've seen, vampire?" The man says "Not exactly Mark, Belfry is a fruit bat completly frugivore." He hands Belfry an apple where Belfry accepts it and chews on it. You ponder the idea "I'm gonna discuss this with my parents. The man says "We'll go with you, I'm sure I can convince her that this is better then a community college."

1112.content:
My name was Exolo, son of the great paladin Exoltia and the late warrior Ragil. I had never done much with my life, never really excelled in sword, sorcery, faith or science, and for most of my life I'd only ever had to deal with the company of other humans. I might bump into the occasional anthro or fae back home in Wistava, but as a human owned city where everything was built to accommodate humans everyone who came there was at least the same shape. Then Mom lost her job and had to move out near the frontier, out where the towns were mixed and both travel and trade come from as many people as they could get. Of all shapes, sizes and sorts. It was here I had to face the most dangerous, the most eerily perilous task in my life. The first day of college in a new city.

Or at least that's what my mother kept telling me as she fitted the last few plates onto my shoulders.

"But mom! Why do I have to go in full armor? I'm sure the teacher's won't let anyone get hurt there so it's not like I'll need it."

She frowned as she adjusted the purple tinted metal. Brushing my short brown aside so it would not catch she put the helmet in place. "Do you remember the bullies who used to give you so much trouble when you growing up?"

I smirked at that one. "The only trouble was having to expl- ..."

"Here it will be much worse" Exoltia's harsh tone cut off any attempt at reminiscing my younger days. "Those fights were fair and even, everyone had roughly the same level of power. But this city is filled to the brim with monsters! Of every sort one could think of! Imagine if your old pests had the body of a dragon."

"That's just it mom, ALL sorts. Human might not be the majority but if this school has elves, mice and fairies and they get along safely with everything else I should be just fine. Armor or no."

"Elves and fairies that can cast! That can fly! You can't even manage a healing spell for when you do get hurt. Even if they are safe enough and no one does have any ill temper towards you, fat chance that is, just think of what a minor accident could do your weak little body."

I glared at that one. Strait up into the hulking, fearsome gaze of a woman who scares off werewolves and vampires for a living. Being a freelance bodyguard in a heavily mythical area took guts no matter what race you were. The fact she was in full body armor herself almost every moment of every day, even when she sleeps, sort of exemplified just what type of woman this was.

"I'm not weak." I glowered, fully aware of just who I was comparing myself to. "But If I do get in over my head won't the armor just get in the way? I can't run as fun or really dodge that well while I'm wearing this."

I had half a moment to let the look on my mom's face sink in before her heavy gauntlet clanged hard against the metal of my helmet. With my ears ringing and my skull acheing madly I bowed at the shoulders and placed hands at the side of my head. Didn't matter what sort of protection you have, if mom hits you it HURTS.

"Have you gone daft in your old age boy? What is this, early onset Alzheimer's at eighteen? That's enchanted armor! Or did you forget about the quickrelease already?"

I blinked as the pain died down, going over the list of enchantments in my head. Immunity to acid and rust, almost airtight in how it protected the main body. It was resistant to both fire and cold but it didn't make the wearer flat out immune. A strong enough blast of either is still going to hurt. It was lighter than normal and not the restrictive in the slightest, but still heavy and uncomfortable when worn over my usual robes. Something mom always insisted on. And then there was that quick release, something mom invented special for her whenever she found a situation where speed and stealth was more useful than protection. Heavy armor is noisy. Just mutter the right words into that mark near the neck and each piece of the armor would fall off in an instant. Thankfully it only works for the wearer, so an enemy can't strip away the protection with a single word.

"I remember it, right ... right"

"Jeeze boy, now go get your sword and backpack so we can leave."

Downtrodden, I clanked through the hallway to grab that loathsome scrap of metal mom made me forge. Her's was a massive greatsword, thick and heavy, with numerous offensive enchantments. Mine was slapped together in ten minutes. Didn't even bother with a test swing.

"Got it mom, but do I really need to carry this thing around all day? It won't even fit in the bag you know." I whined. Instantly wishing I hadn't said anything as she predictably offered no sympathy. She carried her giant blade everywhere, same as the armor, and mine was just a shortsword. She could duel wield with blades the size of mine, I never liked using swords at all.

"You know the answer to that on Exo. Come on, you don't want to be la-"

Shhhh ... shunk.

We were both stricken with silence as the metal portion slid out of the handle, piercing into the floor with a metallic ringing sound. My sword fell apart within the first ten seconds of wielding it. Panic stricken, I looked across to my mother's furious glare.

"Goddamnit!" she shouted, her hands flaring with a brilliant light as her patron god took that statement as a request. Her fists closed around the door handle, and with a slight twitch she shattered the wood from it's hinges, sending splinters flying into the yard. "No time to get you a new one and that pathetic scrap heap is useless. Out! Out with you! Hurry to school or it's another eight hours of training you for you."

Nervously I dropped the blade, rushed past the yard and onto the sidewalk, then started the slow walk to my nearby college. Mom stopped long enough to lay a simple trap down where the door was, then continued in the same direction as me towards her current place of work.

I moved slow and noisily, I was tired, sweaty, and miserable under my pile of metal. It was already tiresome to lift my feet off the ground and I hated that sound as my bulky shoes slammed into the cement sidewalk. I wasn't exactly tall or muscular, but not small or weak either. Unless one chose to compare me to that monster of a woman from which I was spawned. Looking behind, I saw her rushing up behind me at the same speed as a jogger, utterly undeterred by the bouncy sheets of metal weighing her down. Her hands folded together and her eyes closed as she recited a short prayer, and an instant later magic swirled around her chest, legs, and feet. She took two steps out onto the street, then bolted at an insane speed. I could not feel any wind through my armor but I could see leaves fluttering about in her wake. A car came zhooming up from behind, and I saw her wave the occupant inside as she easily kept up.

Within moments both were too far away to see, and I still had a short ways to go. Man, why couldn't she at least be a normal paladin! Most get to summon a horse and ride around on that, but Exoltia never needed one. patron saint of The Traveler, along with the usual powers of healing and smiting, she got a limited number of times she could teleport each day. Or open interconnecting portals. Or freakin run at superspeed while wearing half a ton of metal! Jesus, I could see WHY it's useful to charge into a fight. A heavy fighters much more of a threat when he charges you with the speed of a car. But it's still weird that I'm the only one in my family who's ever had the slightest interest in driving or owning a car. I'm the only one who'd ever need it.

It was less annoying, and more depressing, to think about the members of my family who were no longer alive ...

So I didn't. I looked at the sparkling green lawns, the dark furred, elderly brownie watering her flowers, the oddly proportioned goblin children playing around in their driveway. It was the usual sights, other than an old witch in the bright red house no one around here was particularly exotic or dangerous. And I'm pretty sure that witch was a fine person, and only seemed weird because I hadn't gotten a chance to meet her yet. Heh, a helmeted suit of armor clanking down a street in the morning light? I was probably the strangest and most dangerous person around. I know for a fact mom was the most intimidating.

Wiping the sweat from my brow, I took off my helmet and placed it in the leather sack I used for a backpack. Not exactly modern but it was the type mom knew how to make, and I was sort of used to how it distributed weight. My short hair flowing in the wind, I closed my eyes and enjoyed the cool air on my beads of sweat as I neared a large building. Cocking an eyebrow at the size, I read "Newbrook University college" and stepped into the car lot. There were dorms on one side, classes on another, and all were unusually large. The doors and windows seemed massive, but given the proportions it could only have been one story high. I saw merged flashes of the other students milling about, getting out of cars and moving on to their own classes, but my attention was instead focused on how to get into the door.

Staring at it, I noticed much smaller ones off to the side, doors roughly sized for a rodent or gnome, but there wasn't one in between dragon sized and mouse sized. Grunting, I shoved into the door and found it easy enough to move, if a bit noisy, then squeezed my way into the main hall. Rows upon rows of lockers, intermittent with the doors to different classrooms were all there was to say about the background. It was instead the students who were the most clamorous in greeting me.

11132.content:
Tyler is your name, as born to the Keenly family, being the second to the eldest son, he being Frank. The family in general had on it a curse. The curse came from a long dead grandfather who during his life sat as a judge during the Salem witchcraft trials.

As the story was told from father to son within the family, a witch on trial tried to use her gender to sway the judgement, and when she taunted, coaxing, flaunted before him of what old granddad, he took it as an insult. Somewhere during the lengthy trial, the witch woman approached granddad and tried to kiss him. He slapped her face, and had the woman flogged in public for her being so daring. The witch woman cursed then granddad, as caused him to ignore his wife and see then the lovely attributes of jennet donkeys.

As told, the history of granddad turned a fated corner, and he ceased to be, but was suspected that he became a donkey himself.

Since then, as though the decades, each new generation, the menfolk when coming of age, usually at eighteen, but some at twenty-one, they began to show physical aberrations, deviating from being all human, to becoming in part or all as an animal; mattering upon their personal preferences toward various animal breeds.

Anthropic deviations in the species of all males in the family, as many like granddad went the way of being equines, donkey, ponies, horses, and one odd relation went full-on into becoming a stallion Zebra.

The planning to attend a college brought on the need to earn money, and when a girlfriend did the arrangements, her grand idea for getting a good paying job was as a farmhand at her Uncle's goat milking business.

Mother was not happy at the choosing to work at milking goats, as their species and mine might well merge. Mom was right, as during that first summer my body became infected from association with doe goats. The milking was done by hands on, and the lunch time breaks came with served up goat milk to drink. As such, I became as one socially diseased, as cursed male, my body began to grow black goat fur, as similar to the black color of my human hair.

Fur sprigs grew around my ears, as flared big my eyebrows. Clipping off of the fur caused it to spread, as gaining fur covering all my neck, and soon then my chest and back. The growth of black fur was unrelenting, spreading to by the end of the first summer working at the goat farm, I had a full body pelt of black goat fur from head to my feet.

Mr. Darren who owned the goat farm had seen me showering before leaving the farm to go home. He asked as how the fur happened and I told him of our family history. To say the dear man questioned the tale as told, was to me not a laughing matter.

The body fur was but the beginning to fall and winter months of ridicule at high school, by foes and friends knowing I had grown a pelt of goat fur. Class girls thought to date me and wanted to comb their long petite fingers through the curly locks of goat fur what covered my body, arms, legs and everywhere. Their sensual taunting worked to arouse me, and from my male feeling as stout, the curse moved to cause me changing of my maleness to be that like a buck goat.

My working around the doe goats and milking them began to affect my preference of liking doe goats as friendly companionship more so than dating girls. Oh but please understand me that I never thought to act like some buck goat in rut, no, no way, as that is evil.

My third summer spent milking goats caused me to sprout two horns growing from the peak of my forehead. The drinking of goat milk at break times and lunch worked to enhance my horns to grow some eight inches long. It happened that summer my ears conformed to being similar of what a goat has for floppy ears. My mother cried when she first noticed I had sprouted horns.

My two younger brothers, Jay and Wilson both thought my changed self as really neat.

Dad had left the family some years earlier, as when I turned ten, he by then resembled being more a Jack donkey, that mom later sold dad to an amusement park for him to pull a trolley. My dad never saw how his son had changed or caused the curse to include then of bovine animals as possible futures of the family males.

When came the end of summer and my time to return to school, what had become me was more an Anthropic male goat than I was looking human enough to attending high school. I tried then home-schooling and tending to my studies I gained the next spring my graduated high school degree. I wondered what to do next when again my still friendly girl-friend suggest the entry into the Mythical College.
11132.title: Socially Diseased

111321.content:
MYTHICAL COLLEGE, I applied and received an immediate reply of my admission as a Freshman, an Anthro-Satyr Goat.

I had accepted the truth about my body changing, but I was much more akin to being a goat than to my being considered a Satyr.

A day later and I received a notice of acceptance from Bovine Hall, as the name implied, the residence for only those being of the bovine species. When Mom saw the notice from Bovine Hall, she began to cry. Her crying was not from the thought of losing my friendly self living at home, but from the social relief from bias neighbors and family relatives what thought less of me because I became as a male buck goat.

Buck Goat, yea I did change the family curse, broadening it to envelope another species and breeds that might defile the family further. As from just after being born, buck goat tend to fight for the want to dominate, first each the other bucks, as then stand mounted, dominating the herd of doe goats with breeding rights.

Breeding rights, that was what everybody had on their evil minds. Relatives worried I might molest their sweet daughters, maybe injuring them with my..., well not my horns!

I did not help the matter when after Auntie Maria, an old maid spinster of our family on father's side, she wrote a letter, sending it to the family as a whole. Auntie dear suggested my Anthropomorphic self was the result of devils, and my becoming to be a black furred almost goat, meant I was in league with evil. I read her letter and quickly, as without much thought, wrote out an e-mail to the family, denouncing I was evil, and reassuring their daughters Hymen was safe and intact!

"Being evil is stupid and acting stupid is from evil," as I learned the hard way!

As it happens, the young male goats do about the same as will their elders, when it comes to preparing for the Rut season. Most male goats seem to appreciate urinating upon their forelegs, and dipping their heads to whiz on beards and the back of their heads. The result is a wild stench to where the farmer tending the goats needs to wear as use breathing apparatus, lest they get infected with bacterial diseases.

When a real doe or a rarer anthro-doe should enter her mating season, the wagging of her tail rapidly, termed as flagging, spreads her scent into the breeze. Noted, and since by yours-truly, the odor of doe goat urine as it contains chemicals what radiates to her buck that she is ready to breed.

My part begins after the Flehmen and sniffing, as a Buck will do his urination thing, and with some other less moral style manners, they will mate. Flehmen reaction happens, as with the curling of the upper lip after giving the doe goat a royal sniff, works to help capture her mating scent, and works to arouse the Buck to..., mate.

A special sensitivity in the lips their lips to determine, as how far along the doe is with feeling her estrus. This is what I might need to deal with if my portion of the curse does me an injustice.

Me a freshman at college, even a college specified for those handicapped with curses or rare diseases, as with attending there, I expect the usual hazing, harassment, as even the female will coax me to mount.

Anthropic's like true animals tend to brawl, some fight, as it can go on for hours until the pecking order is specified.

College, even a school for higher learning a new student needs to deal with sinister brutality, deception, bedevilment, and egotistic professors.

My curriculum blocks out as: English Literature, New Math, Anthro-science, and some form of athletics.

You were not really amazed by your classmates’ reception. After all you had always been the center of attention, the main heritor of the Kitsune Clan; how would it be possible to not be at the center of the gazes?

++++++

The third period was finally over. It had being interesting be surrounded by you new fans, but now you want something to calm your hunger and the cafeteria would be a better point to overlook for more girl for your growing entourage.

And what would be your surprise when you reached the place and it looks like no one had noticed your entrance. But the little number of girls there, “that might be the reason for” –you think., So you just look around and your eyes stopped in a really gorgeous girl.

Black hair, peachy skin, golden eyes, huge breast, a pair of wolf ears, and by her look, somehow, it was obvious that she was from the upper levels.

So you decided to approached her and get her as part of your harem.

“Hi, honey. How is it that you’re so lonely?” You asked her in the most charming tone you had. But you just got a threatening glance in response.

“Why are you so shy?” You tried to caress her white cheek. But she rejected that with her hand, and before you could react, she took you by the neck with a murdering aura coming from her.

“Get out of my sight.” She ordered you throwing you to the floor.

“Come on, who do you think I am?” You asked in an all high and might way while getting up.

“I don’t care.” She answered before continuing with her meal.

You just noticed the silence among the students around you.

“Might I ask you, then, who are you?” You asked her seeing her down.
11412.title: Lone Wolf

114122.content:
The only sound in the cafeteria came from the wolf-girl finishing her meal.

“So you got out of words!” You skewered her, but she said nothing in respond.

“Are you scared?” You approached your face to hers just to see a pokerface. Then when she tried to get out, you decided that her attitude must need and apologize, but when you tried to stop her, before you even could react, you found your way on the air through the window.

The time stop for a second before you found your-self on the grass.

“What had happened?” You thought. “Up until now there had never been anyone who had been able to beat you, but she did it so easily.”

You stood recumbent on the grass looking to the sky trying to understand what had happened when an angelical face appeared in front of you.

“Are you alright?”

You couldn’t respond.

+++++

“Stay calm!” A voice ordered you in a gentle an quite childish tone, while you suddenly react trying to stand up.

“Where I am?”

“The school infirmary.”

“Oh! I remembered now!” You said embarrassed. “That girl just send me through the window”

“You was lucky, you just got little flesh wounds.”

“How could that be being lucky?”

“Well, Akane-chan is the strongest student of the school. She is call ‘The Rising Star of Hachisu no Yoru Style’”

“Style?”

“So you don’t know!” She laughed cutely. “Aoi Akane is the heiress of the Okami clan, and even being just a sophomore, she has became the captain of the Karate, Judo and Kendo female clubs.”

“That’s really amazing, I must accept,” you breathed resting again in the infirmary bed. “By the way, I’m Yuu Shiraii. And you?”

“Oh, sorry, I haven’t introduce myself” she approached to the bed and smiled you, “I’m Elise Lightroad. Nice to meet you!”
114122.title: A Sophomore Captain

1141221.content:
“So…” You deeply breathed. “Might I go now, Elise-chan?”

“Oh, sorry, you must wait till the nurse approval.”

You raised your head a little to observe that angel again. A gorgeous blond girl was seating just in front of the rooms desk, a completely mature fruit just waiting for someone to bite it.

“Ah, then you are a trainer nurse.”

“You could say so,” she answered with a wondering pause, “I’m just helping out at my free time…”

“Free time? Might you be still studding?”

“I’m still a junior here.”

“A junior!?”

“Oh, I hadn’t tell you,” she cutely laughed, “you must be really surprised, but since I’m the second in class, and I’m looking for a medic career after graduation, I got permission from principal to help a little bit here.”

“You really surprised me.” You laughed resting your head at the pillow again.

+++++

There had barely passed a few minutes, but an unbreakable silence came over the infirmary.

Silence… Not completely, but frustrating to the point of madness.

“I’m going!” You shouted while lifting up.

“Oh, my, you can’t go out without the nurse permission after you had fainting.”

“But it was just because Akane-senpai threw me through the window!”

“That my be true, but still you can’t go as you please.”

“Come on!”

“Sorry, but rules are rules!”

“It’s not as if I were asking you,” you sentenced and walked to the door.

Suddenly, before you could reach the latch, the sheet trapped you and imprisoned you on the bed just with enough movement to see Elise using a magic wand.

“A witch!”

“Ara, ara. You noticed,” she replied with just a little of surprised in her tone.

“It was obvious after the sheets moved on it's own and even more by the wand you are holding!”

“Oh, my. It won’t do any good if someone knows what I am.”

“It’s not as if the rule of hiding our true nature isn’t that inflexible.”

“Mmmm… It might be better if I just erase your memory,” and with that words she took from nowhere a huge mallet.

“And what is that for?” You asked with a bad feeling.

“Well, I’m not really used to Memory Eraser Spells, so causing you amnesia with a hit might be my best option,” she explained her plan as it was the more obvious thing on earth.

“Wait, wait! You can’t be being serious!”

“It’s a shame, but we might met again after you had lost your memories,” she lifted the mallet and swung it to your head.
1141221.title: Alchemy of Health?

11412212.content:
“NO!” You shouted while the shadow of the mallet approached to your face.

The time stops.

“Ara, ara. What happened?” Asked Elise seeing that her mallet suddenly became a pillow.

‘I’m saved!’ You thought relived.

“What were you planning to do to the patient!”

“Oh, Mattou-sensei,” she answered in that unconcerned and childish tone of her. “Yuu-kun found that I’m a witch, so I was going to cause him amnesia.”

You couldn’t see it, but by the bump you saw on Elise head a little bit after, you managed to deduce that Mattou-sensei had smacked Elise in the head to scold her by that shameless answer.

It took no time to Mattou-sensei to free you from the bed.

“Please forgive my idiot assistant,” she said while kneading her head.

“But sensei, he…” Elise tried to complain, but was stopped by murderous glance of the nurse in charge.

“If everything is fine, you can go now Shiraii-kun.”

“Mmm…”

“Is there any problem?”

“Well,” you feel fine, but there was a gorgeous reason, a huge breasted one, which maintained you there, “might you like to go out with me?” You asked in a all or nothing bet.

“Another moron child,” she skewered while smacking you on the head.

+++++

Classes had finished that day and instead of gaining a harem, all you got was a bump on the head. ‘At least caused by a murderous goddess,” you thought for yourself while walking to the dormitories.
11412212.title: A demonic Goddess

114122121.content:
“Dam it! What a day!” You shouted annoyed by your first day, “how comes I had be beaten by such a girl!” You kick the door of your dorm and entered just to find an unexpected scene.

“Eh?” You couldn’t say anything else, but got completely red before getting out of the room and closed the door.

‘Wait a second. Was just there cute girl changing inside?’ You thought trying to understand, ‘is this a mix dormitory? Might I have been send to heaven by those freaking witches? What ever I will just get inside!” You breathed deeply and get in.

“I’m coming in!” There was not a dream; just inside was waiting a really cute girl or at least it looks like that.

“Welcome,” she smiled you kindly, “You must be Yuu Shiraii-kun, the transferred freshman, don’t you?”

“Yes, I’m Yuu Shiraii, but you can call me Shiraii-sama, sweetheart,” you replied in a charming way approaching her.

“You seems like such a nice guy,” she giggled kindly, “I’m Yuki Whitesnow and I’m looking to pass a good time as roommates.”

“Well, mix dormitories most be a great thing.”

“Mix dormitory?” She repeated wondering a little, “as far as I know this is just a boys dormitory,” she sentenced as something irrelevant.

“Boys?”

“Yes, why?”

“But, then… you…”

“Me… I’m a boy of course.”

In just a second everything got cold and you became a stone by the shock.

“A Boy! Are you kidding me!”

“Not at all,” he replied with a childish tantrum face. He looked into your eyes and suddenly realized the reason of your shock. “I forgot completely,” he laughed out loud. “Sorry, you must really be confused,” he laughed again. “I’m into cross-dressing!”

“Cross… cross… CROSS-DRESSING!” You shouted and suddenly felt sick. “This day is just getting worst!” You complained while walking toward the bed at the opposite side form Yuki’s one.

“I’m also a Bi-M if you want to scold me,” he told you.

And you just answered with a murderous glance.

“I’m just kidding,” he giggled.

+++++

It was a frustrating first day, but your life at Tsukuribanashi Academy was just beginning.
114122121.title: A poison Flag

1141221211.content:
White, peace, you couldn’t be more relaxed at that moment.

It was a warm morning, the room was stile dark, but you could already hear the tweet of the birds out side the window. You tried to stay sleep, dreaming, when suddenly someone opened the curtains and the room became brightly. You must still be dreaming since there was no way such a cute apparition might be in front of you shining like the sun.

“Wake up honey!” The apparition told you kindly face to face, when you finally react and remembered the day before.

“Damn it!” You shouted lifting up getting away from Yuki’s face making him laugh.

“You are so cold,” he answered with a sad face, “and I thought we might had a moment yesterday night.”

“Stupid pervert,” you replied smacking his head.

+++++

It took a lot, but finally you got ready and walking to the academy building.

“You are so mean, Yuu-kun” Yuki sentenced kneading the bump you left on his head.

“That’s what a pervert deserves,” you replied with a murderous aura.

“It’s good that you are so cute, ne,” he smiled.

“Are you teasing me?”

“Maybe?”

Yuki just got another bump…

“Well, we separated here.”

“Oh, yeah. You are a third year, right?”

“If you preferred I might stay by your side, “ Yuki giggle.

“You really want to die, don’t you?”

“You need to relax freshman,” he laughed out loud while walking in the opposite direction.

“Why me!” You sighed out loud walking to your classroom when suddenly a big rock fell from the sky just in front of you. And just turning around you managed to see Elise-chan escaping from the scene. ‘This will be a really long day,’ you sighed.
1141221211.title: It has just begun

11412212111.content:
There third period came to be PE class, a basketball practice for boys and volleyball for girls. You would be completely confident if it wasn’t because of the weird presences you had noticed somehow near.

“Are you ready?” Just in that second you noticed in front of you that tall guy that ignored you the last day when all the other guys released a murderous aura when the group girls welcome you.

“I’m always ready, and you?”

“So as I!”

The whistle sounded and the ball got in play. You both jump, but just one managed to control it. The ball fell on the opponent hands and the game began.

Five, ten, twenty minutes passed as nothing and the fighting spirit of the both teams, especially that guy and yours made all the other students of the group and some form others get near the court to see the duel.

40 - 37

“This is getting really interesting,” you said with a tired breathing.

“And this just a PE class,” he laugh exhausted.

“Yeah, but to find someone that could follow my rhythm to the point of exhausted me is really funny,” you sentenced bouncing the ball trying to get a bigger difference.

“Well, the only problem is that I can still continue!”

“That’s how it must be.”

You finally tried to pass him, but at the last moment he took the ball, managed to score three points and tied the score. Last point.

The audience was at the edge waiting for the result of the game that had become a one on one match, since all the other classmates had finally fell exhausted.

The last play began, with you almost in control of the situation, managing to maintain the ball control; but the table twisted when the ball got out of the basket and was recovered by your opponent.

“Damn it!” You shout running behind him.

Every thing was settled if he got the ball inside, you would lose twice in a row since you had entered Tsukuri Academy.

He jumped for a slam-dunk. You jumped trying, with out hope, to stop it.

The time stopped.

“What is this?” You asked squeezing something soft still confused by the falling shock.

“That’s me!” A known voice, containing a moaning, told you and just then you realized you had fell over the tall guy… your in the chest… face to face…

“Don’t tell me that you…” You squeezed again.

“Oh, yeah!”

“Then… this…”

“Your satisfied already?”

“A… a…”

“A girl, you idiot,” she said and you blushed.

“Now lose yourself pervert!” She struck you right in the face and everything blurred.

When you finally opened your eyes to you found yourself in a quite familiar place.
11412212111.title: Another Weirdo

114122121112.content:
‘A deja vu?’ You thought getting out of the bed just in time to avoid the huge wood mallet attack of Elise-senpai. Once again you woke up at the infirmary.

“Don’t tell me you are still trying to causing me amnesia?” You asked sarcastically.

“Ara, ara,” she seemed surprised, “so that’s why I couldn’t erase your memories?”

“Why what?”

“You can read minds,” she sentenced pointing you with her finger.

“Are you really saying it seriously?”

“Yeah!” She replied instantly, “well, if there is no surprise factor; all what is left is a frontal confrontation!” She said lifting the mall again.

“W… wa… wait a little!” You shouted barely avoiding the second attack again, “I got an idea!”

“Idea?” She repeated perplex, “for what?”

“For this craziness!”

“Which craziness?”

“You trying to cause me amnesia…”

“Is it really that crazy? After all the rules says that…”

“Forget about the rules for a second!” You interrupted, “what if I take responsibility of this?” You asked with hesitation.

“Responsibility?” She repeated you again and waited a little bit while thinking and finally answered, “That might work, but I don’t really want to get married yet.”

“Married?” Now you repeated perplex.

“Didn’t you say you would take responsibility for finding my true identity?” She asked in that plain and innocence tone that she used before the “discovery thing”.

“Yeah… I think I did it…” You replied wondering if she was being serious about the marriage subject. “Maybe you are right… We both are still young for getting married, so… what if we start as friends?”

“Well, that might be best,” she paused a little thinking, “Ok, you can call me Elise, Shiraii-kun.”

“You can also call me by my name.”

“Ara, ara. So you really are serious about the proposal,” she thought out loud “Ok. Then, what about Yuu-kun?”

“That’s fine…” You sighed unable to understand how all this confusion had finished in a ‘just be friends’ dumping flag. ‘Never mind,’ you thought considering that at least you were now safe of her amnesia attempts. “So, Elise, I’m going…” You walked toward the door just to crash to it by it’s suddenly close. “What was that?”

“Sorry, but you can’t leave with out the nurse permission,” she sentenced seriously.

‘Not again,’ you thought frustrated. “Are you sure you can’t make an exception this time?” You asked kindly trying to stay in calm.

“Yuu-kun…” She answered lifting up her wand.

“Ok.” You sighed returning to the infirmary bed.

The time passed in silence.

“How much time did I stay unconscious this time?”

“Mmm…” She thought, “About an hour, it’s just to finished the four period.”

“Ah…” You sighed tired letting you weigh fell upon the bed and suddenly a quite notable sound came from your stomach.

“Ara.” Elise said surprised, “That was quite loud. Are you starving?”

“It sounds so…” you answered too tired to get up from the bed.

“Ok, you can eat this,” Elise said giving you a bento box.

“A bento?” You asked surprised, “Did you eat?”

“That’s the one I prepared for sensei, but she said she was going to eat with Yamato-sensei at the cafeteria.”

“Oh,” you answered already eating the bento. “This is really good, did you do it?”

“Yep, I really like to cook,” she giggled.

“You are really a pro,” you sentenced eating the last portion of it. And she just giggled in response.

And in that moment the bell informing the end of the fourth period sounds, just as Mattou-sensei entered at the room.
114122121112.title: Countermeasure

1141221211121.content:
“So you got here again, Shiraii-kun,” Mattou-sensei told you just she got into her desk to sigh you discharge of the infirmary. “You must stop getting in troubles,” she sentenced while giving you the paper.

“But if I do, I won’t be able to see sensei that often.” You replied with a prince smile, just to get a bump again.

+++++

You sighed

“Are you fine, Yuu-kun?”

“Yeah, but are you really going to escort me to the classroom?”

“Well, that’s what Mottou-sensei asked me for.” Elise answered with that innocent tone of her.

You just sighed again and walked in silenced until you reached the classroom.

“So, that’s it,” you said while opening the door, “see ya.”

“Ok, see ya, Yuu-kun.” Elise replied while moving to the next building.

“Yuu-sama!” Five girls welcomed you while getting to your sit. “Are you alright? Nothing hurt you?” They began to ask you just when that girl entered to the classroom and your looks crossed with anger. “Yoshihane-kun is so mean! Doing that to our Yuu-sama…!”

“Don’t get mad, my sweethearts” you told them, “I’m not that weak to get injured by such a little punch.” You smiled and charmed them.
“But you even faint.” One of the girls exclaimed.

“That was just because I was exhausted by the game and I want to skip some classes.”

“You are so mean, Yuu-sama, we were so concerned and you just want to skip classes!”

“Yeah, but just to be rested for all you, sweethearts!” You replied seductively.

And just before your fan club continued, the bell gave start to the fifth period.

The left school time came to be quite relaxing by the simple look at you fans concerned by what passed at the end of the third period. But that came to end with the bell announcing the end of the sixth period.

You stay sat seeing the white ceiling, while everyone got out of the classroom. You took your time waking to the entrance of the building. You got to your shoes case and inside there you found white and plain note.

“I’ll be waiting at the roof,” It read.

‘A challenge?’ you thought. It has always been the same; some stupid guy tries to defeat him just to become popular among girls. The only thing that the one who send the challenge doesn’t know was that that particularly day had been unsatisfactory enough to made you feel like killing sometime by riding someone to the edge of death.

You walked slowly to the roof of the school savoring the blood that will be covering your fists in a few minutes.

You kicked the door of the roof and got outside just to found Yoshihane-kun waiting for you.

“Sshh!” You exclaimed seeing her there. “Don’t tell me that you were the one who left the note?”

“What if I am?” She answered completely serious.

You sighed. “So what do you want? Is not as if I would let you repeat what passed at PE.”

“I’m not here to fight with you, I just one to have a little conversation.”

“Conversation?” You replied already bored by the twist of events. ”Sorry, I don’t have anything to discuss with you.” You said while returning to the building.

“You must take responsibility about what you did to me in front of everyone!” Yoshihane shouted you.

“Take responsibility?” You repeated turning around from the entrance, while remembering hearing such words a few hours ago, just to see the serious but blushed face of Yoshihane. “What do you mean with that?”

“You know…” She blushed even more turning her sight in another direction. “… take responsibility…” Her words began to half-split because f the shame. “Do you get it!” She shouted loosing for just a second her cool appearance.

“I don’t get it at all,” you lied trying to not get involved is another scene like that before with Elise-chan.

“I’m asking you…” She said with trembling words and finished with a barely audible voice, “… out.”

“What you said?” You turned back again.

“I want to go… out… with… you.”

“Eh?”

“I want to go out with you!” She finally said it out loud and you began to regret had staying there.

But answered immediately turning the table from the scene with Elise-sempai, “I have no problem of being friends with you. See you tomorrow.” You said while escaping from there.
1141221211121.title: Challenge Note

11412212111211.content:
That day came to be kind of a disaster. No matter how you looked at it, you were now completely tied to some rare people.

You walked down to the male dormitories through the rod that would drive you through the school woods to the back part of the building. Trees, shadows and silence that was all what you want at that moment and that rod was the best place to get them. That was because the passage itself was kind of misleading, so most of the student body don’t bother themselves taking it if it was no necessary. And for your luck, you didn’t get into anyone.

You walked slow, trying to forget all the crap that took place that day and trying to think on what might come next. You sighed.

“Eh?” You realized that you got out of the correct path just after noticing the building in which you had entered, the Library.

“Oh, Hello.” A cute girl with glasses told you just entering. “Might I help you?”

“Sorry, where am I?” You asked still getting out of your thoughts.

“This is the Third Library building.” She told you while getting near to you.

“The third one?”

“That’s right!” She answered reaching you at the entrance. “Might you have gotten lost?” She asked you with a fresh smile.

“Maybe it was fate?” You answered and she just giggled.

“You must be a freshman, don’t you?” She walked toward her desk and began to look for something.

“Is it that obvious?”

“Well,” she replied, “your first question just entering was ‘where am I?’ wasn’t it?”

“Yes, it was.” You laughed. “So what are you looking for…?

“Oh, yeah!” She exclaimed with out stop mixing the stuff of her desk. “My name is Kiyomi Hanasakura, from third year.”

“So what are you looking for, Kiyomi-chan?”

“This!” She exclaimed raising a key on the air to show you. “And you are still my kouhai!” She faced you, “So call me senpai!”

“Ok, Kiyomi-senpai…”

“Hanasakura-senpai for you!” She scolded you pointing you with her finger barely a millimeter away from your nose. She giggled. “Now follow me.”

You couldn’t do anything but sighed and followed her.

The walk through the library took longer than what you thought it was going to take, but five stairs later you got in front of an old and dusty door. And after giving you a big smile, Kiyomi opened it.

What was on the other side was beautiful. A little, nice and lonely cafeteria warmed by the afternoon orange sun that entered through the glass walls and perfumed by a few vases with flowers.

“This used to be the student council office when this was the main library building,” Kiyomi sighed.

“Is that true?” You asked with a smile.

“At least that’s what the teacher in charge of the Library Club like to tell us, since now just the Third Division of Library Club used it.” She giggled with a little shadow in her purple eyes. “Do you want some tea?”

“Yeah,” you replied feeling a little curious about the place and about your hostess.
11412212111211.title: The Library Girl

1141221211122.content:
“So you got here again, Shiraii-kun,” Mattou-sensei told you just she got into her desk to sigh you discharge of the infirmary. “You must stop getting in troubles,” she sentenced while giving you the paper.

“But if I do, I won’t be able to see sensei that often.” You replied with a prince smile, just to get a bump again.

+++++

You sighed

“Are you fine, Yuu-kun?”

“Yeah, but are you really going to escort me to the classroom?”

“Well, that’s what Mottou-sensei asked me for.” Elise answered with that innocent tone of her.

You just sighed again and walked in silenced until you reached the classroom.

“So, that’s it,” you said while opening the door, “see ya.”

“Ok, see ya, Yuu-kun.” Elise replied while moving to the next building.

“Yuu-sama!” Five girls welcomed you while getting to your sit. “Are you alright? Nothing hurt you?” They began to ask you just when that girl entered to the classroom and your looks crossed with anger. “Yoshihane-kun is so mean! Doing that to our Yuu-sama…!”

“Don’t get mad, my sweethearts” you told them, “I’m not that weak to get injured by such a little punch.” You smiled and charmed them.
“But you even faint.” One of the girls exclaimed.

“That was just because I was exhausted by the game and I want to skip some classes.”

“You are so mean, Yuu-sama, we were so concerned and you just want to skip classes!”

“Yeah, but just to be rested for all you, sweethearts!” You replied seductively.

And just before your fan club continued, the bell gave start to the fifth period.

The left school time came to be quite relaxing by the simple look at you fans concerned by what passed at the end of the third period. But that came to end with the bell announcing the end of the sixth period.

You stay sat seeing the white ceiling, while everyone got out of the classroom. You took your time waking to the entrance of the building. You got to your shoes case and inside there you found a pink envelope closed with a red heart sticker.

You was no surprised, but satisfied by your natural charming. You opened it and read the letter and went to the designed place.

You took your time walking to the back part of the gym. It would be inevitable; you had always been a heartbreaker.

You got there just to see a little but cut girl of long purple hair down the shadow of far tree.

You gave a few steps, when she realized that you had gotten to the appointment and ran to your encounter.

“I like you Yuu-chan!” She said hiding her face against your chest.

“So it was you!” You answered realizing what was all that about.

“Yuu-chan,” she turned her face to you and looked into your eyes with her deep green eyes.

“Do you remember what I told you last time?” You said getting mad.

“That you want to spank me?” She said with a childish tone.

“Don’t get near to me you freak!” You shouted kicking outside the girl.

“You are so mean, Yuu-chan” said the one who got up while its long purple wig fell down discovering Yuki’s green hair. “And I was just trying to cheer you up.”

“And you think that something so awkward would cheer me up!”

“But there’s no guy who doesn’t get cheer when a cute girl confessed to him.”

“But you are no a cute girl!” you smashed Yuki again.

“Yuu-chan!” Yuki replied with a crying voice.

“And cut out that Yuu-chan now,” you sentenced.

“You are so mean,” Yuki said indignant, “baka, Yuu-kun.”

“What ever!” You answered while getting out of that place.
1141221211122.title: Love Letter

11412212111221.title: The Library Girl

choices: Take a walk around the library.
Visit Parker's favorite place- the game room~!
1142.content:
General info:
name: Ryusuke (Galway) Ueno
age: 19
appearance: Long, messy black hair with bangs that sweep to the left, dark grey eyes, tanned skin. Ryusuke is rather thin, standing 5' 9" tall. He is rather partial to solid-colored V-necks and tees, plain hoodies, jeans and black canvas sneakers. He wears several watches on his right wrist (each for a different timezone) and sports headphones most of the time. The only indication that he is out of the ordinary comes from his shadow, which is that of a fox because he is a kitsune, a fox that can shapeshift into human form. He is ambidextrous and temperamental, with rare but sudden mood swings that attest to his wild nature.
other: Ryusuke has been sent to the college to get him out of the way; he is studying to be a music major. He is from another country and should be expected to have different views of college life. He is not a party animal, though he does not spend all of his time studying either. He likes to sleep and play music; he can play the synthesizer, bass, guitar, and flute. He has no interest in romance, though he will play along just to oblige those friends he makes. He is a misogynist, but can endure working with the opposite gender.

His roommate's name is John Kumiega. He has brown hair and light blue eyes; he stands 6' 1" tall and wears button-down flannel plaid shirts and long dark pants that he tucks into his boots. He is a wolf anthro, though the only signs of it come from his wolf ears and tail. He is faster, stronger, and more enduring than normal humans, with better sight, hearing, and smell. He insists on calling Ryusuke strange names such as "Yukey" and "Lis". He is a philosophy major.

---
You give a sigh as you park your bike by your dorm. You'd like to leave immediately and crawl back under your duvet at home, but you can't, and you walk up the steps gingerly after locking your ride, slinging your pack over your shoulder. "Hmm, August Hall, A-13," you mutter as you glance at the doors. "Ah... here it is."

You slowly unlock the door and go in, coughing with distaste at the smell- the scent of old leftovers, sweaty gym clothes, and—what's that?—vomit? washes over you as you gasp in the fetid air. "Oh Cod," you groan before managing to open the grimy window and fanning out as much of that disgusting air as possible. As a faint breeze wafts in, you take deep breaths to rid yourself of that horrible impression, then turn back to survey the disaster behind you.

It's actually not as dirty as you thought it would be, only slightly messy and worn, a few stray articles littering the maple wood floor. A sturdy black table, three (grey) wooden chairs, a desk lamp. Two beanbag chairs (dark blue), two dressers (identical), a tall full-length mirror, with one corner cracked by some sort of blunt instrument. Two extra doorways, one leading to, let's see, a small kitchen, the other a rather old-fashioned lavatory—no, that's not the word, it's supposed to be bathroom— with relatively clean fixtures. A closet filled with junk. "Hell," you say tiredly as you throw your bag into a corner and sinking into a beanbag. "Where have I been sent to?"

A sudden slight movement from the bunk beds startles you; you turn to stare at a moving pile of blankets from the lower bunk, when a grubby face looks out and grumbles, "Whoozzit?"

"Um," you reply, at a loss for words. "Er, I guess I'm your new roommate... who are you?"

The figure gets up, rubbing its eyes, and you see that it's a guy, maybe a year older than you, with ruffled brown hair, bleary blue eyes, and an affectionate attitude as he lurches out of bed and grabs you, pulling you onto the floor as he growls, "Hey, you're fresh meat, aren't ya? Welcome to hell, buddy! I'm sure you'll like it here wit' me, li'l friend."

You disentangle yourself with some embarrassment, standing up as you shift away. "I don't believe we've been formally introduced yet," you say cordially, ignoring the messy heap before you. "My name is Ryusuke Ueno, although you may call me Galway. I'd rather not explain why I am called that, although I will tell you that it has something to do with music. How are you?"

"Eh?" your roommate grunts, getting up. "Hmph, name's John, John Parker Kumiega, though y' can call me Johnny-boy. How's that, huh?" Swaying a bit, he stumbles to the bathroom and retches, coming out with a slight grin. "Huh, sorry for the mess, man, forgot I was suppos' ta be getting a new roomie today. You 'kay with this? You're lucky ya got ta be with me, my last roomie lasted only a month... anyway, the other dorms have shared facil'ties, so you've got the good stuff right here wit' me! Lucky, eh?"

"Hm." You notice his wolf ears and tail, though you decline to comment. You ignore "Johnny-boy" as you climb the ladder to see that the top bunk is indeed for you, and put your pack onto it. Taking some of your things down, you put them into the indicated receptacles and find yourself done with making yourself "at home". As your roommate prattles on, you finally start listening to hear him say, "Yep, and that's why I never drink Pepto-Bismol in the morning!"

You facepalm in frustration. Looking out of your second-story window, you gaze over the grounds, then suggest a tour, since it's your first day at the college.

"Sure!" John says jovially, cuffing you upside the head as you check your pockets for your keys. "By the way," he says, becoming serious, "really sorry for the bad first impression. You don't really have to call me Johnny-boy, John, Parker or even Kumiega'll do just fine. I'll call you Yukey, 'kay? Yeah, I'll try laying off the drink next time, but when you get thirsty... abnegation ain't the first thing you'd think about."

Brightening up, he grabs you and gives you a quick noogie, then heads out the door singing "Mazurek Dąbrowskiego", trailing you along like the little freshman you are.
1142.title: Ryusuke

"I don't know if I can do this", you mutter to yourself. "I mean every thing just so big. What if I get crushed or eaten or worse." Your name is Twigs Timber and you have just started school at the Mythical College. Despite being a mythical creature yourself, Homuncules are ignored by all three races, wither they be anthro, human, or mythical. They were ignored for their small size and pitiful physical prowess. In ages long since past they were once used to replace lab animals because they were very easy to make and their existence was thought expandable.

But thanks to the amazing intelligence and longevity they showed they were welcomed into society after a long fifty years of struggling to get rights. Even after obtaining rights Homuncules were forbidden to enter any educational facility because of the great risk factor of getting injured or killed. But all that changes with you. You are attending this college as representative for your race and to show that it is possible for Homuncules to be able to attend school without getting hurt. Furthermore by undergoing this project your kind will be able to expand their job market. You were chosen for this project for your vast intellect on all subjects.

Now the only thing that you have to do is walk up to the school and meet your bodyguard to assure your safety at the school. There were still some races that thought your kind was expandable and others who taught you were pets, toys or pests. A bodyguard was necessary. According to what you had heard your bodyguard was also a student and your roommate. You didn't know much more then that and that frightened you. But you had to suck it up and hope that your roommate would be willing to protect you and like you at the same time. Now all you had to do was walk up the stairs and meet him. choices: You start your first lesson with Elgoran.
Sylvaria call you and Telmaralon into a meeting.
121.content:
I apologise for any confusing Enlish/American spelling variations.

I stare at the cobble floor beneath my feet and wait. The silence seems endless. I knew the three professors by name before I arrived - who didn't? Their reputation across the worlds was unprecedented. I'd only managed a quick glance before I'd felt the compulsion to kneel before them. Still, it had been enough for me to take a pretty good guess at who was who.

Sylvaria the Principle saw in the centre. Her mane of silver hair and her folded metallic wings gave her identity away. To her left was the Head of Dark Magics 'Elgoran', his black eyes had been vacuous and I'd been glad to no to have to gaze on him any longer than necessary. That left Telmaralon the Head of White Magics. It was she over all the others that compelled me to kneel. Did she know it yet? Probably not but the instant I saw her I knew she was my eternal rider. She was the one I was destined to stay beside until the sun finally set on the last of my days.

In spite of my knowledge, nothing changed the fact that they could still throw me out on my dragon hide if they refused my application to join the.

Her voice broke the silence. Musical notes bounced across the airways as she intructed me to show myself.

I did just as she asked. As I straightened my legs and stretched my back my eyes met hers and I could see that she did know. How this was possible I had no idea, but I was certain of the fact.

As is tradition, I spread my purple and gold streaked wings as wide as was possible. She stood and walked towards me. Sylvaria and Elgoran looked on in confusion as she reached into my wings and snapped a single purple feather from the masses. She walked round and stood fact to face with me, her tiny human form had the presence of an ant stood by an oak tree.

"It is done" she said and I bowed my head in acknowledgment of the arrangement that was now in place.

Telmaraln turned to her colleagues "He joins us" she stated and returned to her seat.
121.title: Their decision

1221.content:
The knight's armor glistened iridescently in the morning sun.The strong light dazzled the dragon.

Dazed,the dragon lost her concentration.
Alas!She could not recover herself soon enough.

The knight took advantage of her confusion,and charged outright.His dark magic,coupled with his combat skills proved to be a deadly combination.The poor dragon wriggled uneasily in his iron grip.

"A warrior who can defeat me has NEVER been born! Were you under the false impression that a puny creature like you could defeat ME? Ha ha ha!!!",the knight laughed heartily,already certain of his victory.

"I ca-ca-can de-defeat you!",the dragon somehow managed to say,gasping for breath.

Sure enough,she soon proved her worth!
What she did next was so amazing that no one in the mythical college could ever dream of!
